intro: Persoonia gnidioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geebung, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and yellowish to orange flowers that appear in clusters. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. It belongs to the Proteaceae family, which includes many plants with specialized adaptations for nutrient-poor soils. Persoonia gnidioides plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
